byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Blinder, Nikita Stewart, Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Ron Nixon from Baltimore, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.

abstract: Hundreds of people remain in streets of West Baltimore past 10 pm curfew after day of mostly peaceful protests; tense mood lingers after largely peaceful day in which hundreds helped to clean up stores ravaged by riots; questions have been raised about whether Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake waited too long to request that Maryland Gov Larry Hogan send in National Guard, and whether city's police were unprepared.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of police officers and National Guard troops worked to maintain order and enforce a curfew amid scattered reports of clashes after a day of largely peaceful protests.

headline.main: Crowds Scatter as Baltimore Curfew Takes Hold
headline.print_headline: Crowds Scatter as Baltimore Curfew Takes Hold

snippet: Thousands of police officers and National Guard troops worked to maintain order and enforce a curfew amid scattered reports of clashes after a day of largely peaceful protests.
